alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 10:32AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Salinas River near Bradley affecting Monterey County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...The river has fallen below Minor flood stage however minor flooding continues as flood waters gradually recede. The river is forecast to drop below monitor stage Friday morning. * WHERE...Salinas River near Bradley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to recede and is forecast to drop below monitor stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. Monitor stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 02/08/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. This will be the last river flood statement on this event. Stay tuned to developments.
